messages.subject: Meds was "What a child needs"
messages.msgSnippet: ... Cathy, you d love the stuff they give my son when he has a bad cold..For some reason, many medicines in Japan are given in powder form, so for a small
messages.messageBody:
>>. I have never been
>>able/willing to take meds. The few times when it could not be avoided I
>>always washed them down with something sweet. Usually a milkshake. Now my
>>kids are the same way so they pick their favorite thing and I stock up on
>>it until their done having to take meds.

Cathy, you'd love the stuff they give my son when he has a bad cold..For
some reason, many medicines in Japan are given in powder form, so for a
small child it has to be mixed with something and one of the things on the
list is ice cream. As you can imagine, I NEVER have trouble getting my son
to take that medicine! In fact, after breakfast today he reminded me that
I'd forgotten to give it to him, LOL..

Hikaru
